result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Depke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 1 day sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Prescott, Arizona if they are willing to take him through the inter-state compact.  Court will allow for the defendant to reside with his aunt in Illinois or his mother in Arizona pending the processing of the transfer to the State of Arizona.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to DNA surcharge - PAID IN FULL.  Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Continue with all treatment deemed appropriate.
No contact with April S.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Case 15CF1365 is dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 1 day sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 1.
AMENDED 03-08-2016:  Length of Probation has been amended to 1 year.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael D Depke in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Defendant's Mother presented a statement to the court.
Defendant's Aunt presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.




Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  3 Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  1.5 Years.
1 Days Credit.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Prescott, Arizona if they are willing to take him (through the inter-state compact).
Court will allow for the defendant to reside with his aunt in Illinois or his mother in Arizona pending the processing of the transfer to the State of Arizona.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Continue with all treatment deemed appropriate.
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  April Stone.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail.
Balance to be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  








Count 2:
30  Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
1 Day Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.


Term of Probation:  2 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
